instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi. i have here water damage board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no powering up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but still nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: when i connect charger. green light is on the red after 5 second is off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
resistance between pin 27 and 28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> - 20.7 Ohm
resistance between pin 17 and 18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> - 3.9 Ohm
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> pin 1 - 20v and pin 2 - 17.18v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 3 - 4.65v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 19 - 5.45v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 14 - 0.73v
not sure what should i check more or how to fix this board. anybody can help me here please? Will be much appriciate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> getting hot. Board consume 0.99 amp on power supply

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> shouldn't get hot.

"changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>"
Which was the reason to change it?

Resistance to ground (diode mode) at L7030?
Do you get steady 3V42 and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/35and <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  - 3.25v
steady 3v42
ressistance to ground on L7030 - 1.6 OHM
also i change <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> and change <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/35

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"ressistance to ground on L7030 - 1.6 OHM"
So you powered up a shorted board...
Remove F7040/41 and see where the short remains.
Do NOT power the board again, until short is gone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: F7040/41 removed and  pin 2 is  1.6ohm  pin 1 15 kohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
So the short is on the system side.
Now check which big coil gest the same value (1.6 ohm) to ground.
Start with L7510/20/30 and L7550/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power up missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check which one gives lower ohm value to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
That one will disclose the burnt high-side MOSFET.
In fact these coils are in group of 2-3.
If you get 3-3.5 ohms is OK.
Less than 0.5 ohm will point you to the culprit.
After that, measure G-S ohm value for the respective MOSFETs of the group.
Usually one from 2, or 3 connected in the same rail is shorted.
